intro: Collomia cavanillesiana, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Collomia cavanillesiana is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access moisture.
